title: On The Block
text: Is this supercool Oakland pad an incredible bargain? By Anna Marie Erwert on January 13, 2017 at 4:03 AM MLS property records tell us that whatever was at 1063 60th St. in Oakland (before this current version) was built in 1900; but the home you see now is brand new. The work of BaranStudio, this three … The cutest S.F. cottages asking under $850K By Emily Landes on January 12, 2017 at 4:03 AM If you are hoping to take part in the “tiny house” trend, the properties in the gallery above may be just the single-family homes of your dreams. They’re cute, compact and, best of all, come with a … Single-family a few blocks from Cortland Ave. for 595K By Emily Landes on January 11, 2017 at 4:03 AM It may have a checkerboard floor in the dining room and a burnt orange oven in the kitchen, but you can bet that 727 Andover St. in Bernal Heights will sell for well over its asking price. How can we … Buy this Castro home as is, or construct permit-approved modern home instead By Anna Marie Erwert   4:00 AM This Castro home could appeal to many buyers. As is, the property offers a 3,600-square-foot lot upon which a two-bed, one-bath home now sits. The original home, built in 1927, has some lovely … The average ‘fixer-upper’ in S.F. is now $920,000 By Emily Landes on January 8, 2017 at 3:47 AM In San Francisco, homes labeled “fixer-uppers” sold at an average of 15 percent above the list price in 2016, with a median sale price of $920,000, according to a new year-end report from Paragon Real … An all-seasons ‘tiki room’ in the redwoods for $699K By Emily Landes on January 6, 2017 at 4:35 AM For those of you who can’t get enough of the tiki theme at the Tonga Room and Trader Vic’s, you’ve got to see this new listing in the Santa Cruz mountains. The mountain lodge amidst the redwoods has … Stunning new construction, new listing in Ross hits the MLS at $9M By Anna Marie Erwert   4:00 AM When 63 Laurel Grove sold to its current owners in 2013, it was a modest, older home on 3.4 acres in Ross, CA. According to listing agent Jenny Mattson, that home was torn down so that this current … Home prices in last year rose at pre-bubble pace. Here’s the new Bay Area median home. By Anna Marie Erwert on January 3, 2017 at 4:00 AM U.S. home values rose 6.5 percent year-over-year in November to a median value of $192,500. And, according to Zillow’s report for November, the current pace of appreciation is the fastest the nation … Loading...
